isis.stitle: STEERABLE DRIVE AXLE END UNIT: FABCO - REMOVE

svcproc.title: REMOVE
svcproc.para: In cases where complete teardown is not required, such as when servicing the inner axle seal, the steerable drive end assembly can be removed from the axle as a unit.
Removal of the steerable end is easier if you use a steerable end mounting tool ( Figure 2). The tool is available from Fabco, or it can be fabricated from the drawings in SPECIAL TOOLS.

step1.para: Raise the front of the truck with a jack and secure with jackstands of suitable capacity.

warning.para: A jack must never be used alone to support vehicle while under-chassis service is being performed. The jack may lower and serious personal injury could result. Always support vehicle with floor stands.

step1.para: Remove the front wheel for the side being serviced.
Remove the tie rod end from the spindle assembly.
Remove all eight 12-point capscrews that secure the universal joint to the axle shaft and yoke shaft ( Figure 3). Pry the joint away from the shafts and remove it.
Loosen the upper kingpin adjusting screw jam nut and back out the adjusting screw until the spindle yoke stops moving downward and is resting on the suspension yoke.

Remove the four 3/4" steering arm or upper kingpin cap locknuts, and pull the arm or cap up off its mounting studs. If difficulty is encountered, turn the adjusting screw back in to force the arm or cap off the studs ( Figure 4).

figure.caption: Figure 4. Removing the Upper Kingpin Cap

step1.para: Attach the steerable end removal tool to a jack and mount it to the steerable end by means of the lowest three wheel studs and nuts. Thread the 3/4"-16 x 3.5 inch bolt up through the bottom of the base plate and into the nut furthest from the vertical plate. Adjust the bolt to contact and support the brake drum. If the tool is not available, alternate means to support the steerable end must be found before continuing this procedure.
Loosen the lower kingpin locknut and completely remove the locknut, lock washer and lower kingpin ball stud from the spindle yoke.

Remove the 7/8 inch upper kingpin bolt and its locknut and two attendant washers from the suspension yoke. Use special tool number 866706 ( Figure 5) to pull the upper kingpin ball stud from the suspension yoke. The tool is available from Fabco, or it can be fabricated from the drawings in SPECIAL TOOLS. Fit the tool's two tubes over two diagonally located steering arm or upper kingpin cap studs. Insert the 1 inch-14 bolt through the washer and the tool's central hole and start it in the threads in the top of the upper kingpin ball stud. Tighten the bolt until the ball stud is pulled free of the suspension yoke.

figure.caption: Figure 5. Upper Kingpin Ball Stud Remover

step1.para: Disconnect the air line from the brake chamber.
Roll the jack backward to disengage the steerable end from the axle ( Figure 6).

figure.caption: Figure 6. Disengaging the Steerable End From the Axle
